name: Red Sky at Night
description: Don't worry, you won't regret whipping up the batch of rosemary simple syrup this drink calls for. In this cocktail from Chicago's Pops for Champagne, it lends an herbaceous element to the flavors of apple and ginger already in play.
recipeIngredient: 1/2 ounce freshly squeezed juice from from 1 lemon

recipeInstructions.text: To make rosemary simple syrup, combine water and sugar in a saucepan and bring to a boil, stirring until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat and add rosemary sprigs. Let steep for 25 minutes. Discard rosemary and let cool.
Fill a cocktail shaker with ice. Add calvados, rum, lemon juice, and rosemary simple syrup. Stir until chilled, about 10 seconds. Strain into a highball glass filled with ice.
Fill halfway to top with ginger beer, then to the top with cava. Garnish with a sprig of rosemary.
